isis.stitle: Body Builder Electrical Data Book for Models Built Starting March 1, 2007 - Engine Speed Control Features - 60AJA - Remote Throttle Control Interlocked to Park Brake Applied - Recommended Application: Recovery

svcproc.title: 60AJA - Remote Throttle Control Interlocked to Park Brake Applied - Recommended Application: Recovery
svcproc.para: 60AJA - BDY INTG, THROTTLE CONTROL Accommodation for Single Customer-Mounted External Engine Speed Control Switch, Programmable Mode for Various Switch Actions and Engine Speed Control Option; Useable Only While Vehicle is Stopped and the Park Brake is Applied (requires one Remote Power Module (RPM) input)

TEM or customer-mounted single remote center stable, momentary switch; when the operator moves the switch to the up position, the switch supplies 12 volts to the RPM input to activate Remote engine speed control preset-1; when the operator returns the switch to the center position or stable position, the engine will remain at preset-1 until the operator moves the switch to the down position; in the down position, the switch then supplies a Ground (GND) to the RPM input to deactivate Remote engine speed control preset-1; when the operator returns the switch to the center position or stable position, the engine will remain at idle.

item.para: Momentary 12 volt input to RPM
Park brake applied
Transmission in neutral or park or clutch pedal not depressed
Vehicle speed is less than one MPH
Engine running and at idle
Optional PTO feedback is true.
Momentary GND input to RPM
Park brake not applied
Transmission not in neutral or park or clutch pedal depressed
Vehicle speed is greater than one MPH.
Engine not running
Service brake depressed
Optional PTO feedback not true
This feature requires one RPM input.
If 60AJA is ordered, 12VXU must also be ordered which requires entering TEM or customer-requested Remote engine speed control preset-1 RPMs.
TEM or customer must supply single pull, double throw, center stable, momentary switch and all associated wiring from switch to RPM.

The optional PTO interlock is defaulted off; this interlock only works with International pre-engineered PTO features. If the TEM or customer has one of the International pre-engineered PTO features and needs to have this interlock turned on, this will require an additional parameter change by someone who is at least Diamond Logic® Builder Level 2 or 3 certified.
Use Diamond Logic® Builder to install Body Controller (BC) software feature code 595AKJ, and set the feature code parameters to the following settings:
595AKJ - Set parameter 2035 to 1. Reference feature configuration programmable parameters.
595AKJ - Set parameter 2158 to 3. Reference feature configuration programmable parameters.
595AKJ - Set parameter 2036 to on for optional PTO interlock. Reference feature configuration programmable parameters.
Use Diamond Logic® Builder to remove BC software feature codes 595AKK, 595AKL, 595AKM, and 595AKN.
Use Master Diagnostics to program Engine control module: PTO in-cab control: on
Use Master Diagnostics to program Engine control module: PTO in-cab mode: stationary pre-set
Use Master Diagnostics to program Engine control module: PTO Power Take Off mode: remote and in-cab operation
Use Master Diagnostics to program Engine control module: PTO Preset-1 RPM set (700.00 to 2800.00) (Note: this is the RPM the customer or TEM has requested)

svcproc.para: 1. 2036 TEM_Ext_Eng_Spd_Ctrl_PTO_Ilock; This parameter sets the optional PTO interlock mode on or off. If set on, the Remote engine speed control preset-1 will be interlocked to all International pre-engineered PTO features that use a center panel switch. This means that the remote engine speed control will only be allowed to operate if the PTO is being requested to engage. If this parameter is not set, the engine speed control will operate regardless of the PTO request.

item.para: On
Off

svcproc.para: 2. 2035 TEM_Ext_Eng_Spd_Control_Mode; This parameter sets the mode of operation for the TEM external engine speed control feature and should be set to 1.

item.para: 1, 12 volts on the engine speed control input causes engine to ramp to preset-1. GND on the same input causes the engine to return to idle.

svcproc.para: 3. 2158 TEM_Ext_ Eng_Spd_ Ctrl_Active_State; This is the active state for the external engine speed control switch input to the RPM and should be set to 3.

item.para: 3, 12 volts - The input is connected to 12 volts through a switch.

entry.para: Off - Indicates a 0 is set in for this parameter
On - Indicates a 1 is set for the parameter
If this parameter is a one, external engine speed controls will be interlocked to PTO request.
This parameter sets the mode of operation for the TEM external engine speed control feature.
This is the active state for the external engine speed control switch.

item.para: Reference the connectors tab within Diamond Logic® Builder to verify the correct RPM input pin on the black 23-pin connector. The pin is named Remote_Engine_Speed_Sw_Input.
Connect an 18 gauge wire to input pin, and run this wire to the center pole on the switch.
Connect one of the remaining switch pole to a 12 volt power source.
Connect the only remaining switch pole to a chassis GND source.
Mount switch.

step1.para: Stationary Remote engine speed control preset-1 Activation; Start engine, set park brake, transmission in neutral or park, vehicle speed is less than one MPH, and take the switch to the up position, or supply 12 volts on the input pin labeled Remote_Engine_Speed_Sw_Input, or use Diamond Logic® Builder to force the RPM input pin to the 12 volt state.
Verify the RPM input labeled Remote_Engine_Speed_Sw_Input (pin position specified Diamond Logic® Builder software) is receiving GND as long as the switch is closed.
Verify that the engine ramps to the first preset speed.
If engine does not ramp to the first preset speed, check engine programming to verify that the correct engine speed control parameters are set.
Deactivate the remote engine speed control switch (release GND).
Verify the RPM input labeled Remote_Engine_Speed_Sw_Input (pin position specified Diamond Logic® Builder software) is an open circuit when switch is in the center stable position.
Verify that the engine returns to idle.
